experience: You and Doug both know Ryan Scott, John Battelle, and 6 others

Early in my career, the industry used to "train" juniors. We started writing brochures and coupon copy before we got good print briefs. We worked on the retail tv and radio spots before we got a shot at the bigger, better projects. We presented multiple rounds of work to seasoned, and in my fortunate case, excellent, award-winning CDs. And in the production phase, there was even more scrutiny and guidance. Sadly, this doesn't seem to be the case any more. We throw juniors in the deep end, with little time to nurture their ideas. Rather than give raises, we promote people to senior-this and associate-that, when they've got less than 5 real projects under their belt. As an ECD, I'm juggling a lot and often feel I'm failing to give my juniors the mentoring they need, the mentoring I got. It's easy to kill an idea - it's harder and more time consuming to make a good idea great. The business isn't what it used to be, but we need to preserve and protect the culture of creative learning. Be the change you wish to see in the world. And our industry.
wow! this is why I love helping others pursue their dreams no matter what age.. #nextgeneration #robotics #artificialintelligence

Arrovox strategizes and develops digital marketing solutions. Apps, video, content, paid media.

Co-founder of tool that helps brands maximize the impact and value of their social media properties. It accomplishes that by cross-analyzing a broad set of interaction and engagement data from the brand's various marketing properties, as well as their competitors'.

Provided a range of new media strategic and creative services for a number of global and national brands, including Sony Pictures, Pepsi, PayPal, Warner Bros, EA Games, 21st Century, California Lottery, Countrywide and Mattel.

Early employee charged with building out internal creative department. Responsibilities included defining departmental needs, hiring creative staff, overseeing development of brand television and print campaign, creative, production and performance analysis of all forms of digital advertising, website creative direction, establishment of performance analysis program for campaign optimization, and roll out of content program including a fleet of 8 publications. Worked with Product Development on new products, user interface, revenue models and community development.
Developed traditional media campaigns in addition to early cross-media solutions. Accounts included Apple Computers, Best Western, Pioneer Electronics, Starbucks, and Universal Pictures.

Creative Director and Promotions Director for the largest student-run radio station in the nation, WPGU; Member of Advertising Club; Founded student run agency working on paying local accounts; Features writer for the Daily Illini newspaper. Played in a number of bands around town.
